text:
Hey HubSpot reps. Did you just roll out an update that prohibits the use of the field name "type" in modules? The CLI gives me a `field name cannot be 'type'`  error when trying to upload this. It worked flawlessly literally an hour ago...

Edit: This affects multiple of our client sites (including live sites) and our ability to update them without making breaking changes.
Seeing it inside the design manager UI as well...
Oh wow, there should literally *not* be any limitations on the `field_name` at all, especially if it wasn’t from the beginning.
Hi, <@U6W3H6YN8> <@U5SGFUU80> please look into this and let us know which action should we take by our side or yourself you will revert back the update?
It happened a few more times yesterday.
Pretty sure there have been similar limits in the past... like name and ID, since those props already live on the module object
<@U26BLKGE4> Yes, there are some field names that have been restricted for a long time, such as 'label'. But 'type' is new, or at least it's new that the CLI considers it invalid.

Hi, I am not really sure if this is the correct channel, but I couldn't find any other that seemed more fitting.
We have recently migrated our blog from <http://blog.forecast.it|blog.forecast.it> to our main domain <http://forecast.app/blog|forecast.app/blog>.
We are still seeing the old site map from the old blog domain, so apparently HubSpot is not doing anything about that, when migrating.
Does anyone know how to go about this?
we rolled back this validation, so you should be able to use `type` again
Thanks <@UEKMY50SU>, I can confirm that it works again on my end.
Broke a lot for me.. Glad it’s back. Thanks

hi guys its me again, i have this problem: im trying to make a custom module that identify if the visitor (not contact yet) comes from organic, ppc, referral, etc… its like a contextual option, but i just cant identify in code how to make this.
Some time ago i make something similar but with contacts ant list memberships, and im sure that can be done with visitors becouse a contextual option can doit!
